index.title: The 18th International Confence on Provable and Practical Security
index.subtitle: (ProvSec 2024)

cfp.title: Authors are invited to submit original research papers on provable and practical security. Areas of interest include, but are not limited to:
cfp.cfp_instruction:
All submissions should use the Springer LNCS format. The final camera-ready version must be at most 20 pages excluding the bibliography, well-marked appendices, and supplementary material. Details on the Springer LNCS format can be obtained here. Authors should not change the font or the margins of the LNCS format. There is no page limit on the appendices and supplementary material. Note that reviewers are not required to read the appendices or any supplementary material. It is strongly encouraged that submissions are processed in LaTeX. All submissions must have page numbers.
All submissions must have page numbers. All submissions will be blind-refereed and thus must be anonymous, with no author names, affiliations, acknowledgements, or obvious references. Submissions must be submitted electronically in PDF format. Submissions must not substantially duplicate work that any of the authors has published elsewhere or has submitted in parallel to a journal or any other conference/workshop that has proceedings. Accepted submissions may not appear in any other conference or workshop that has proceedings. Submissions not meeting these guidelines risk rejection without consideration of their merits.
cfp.cfp_guideline: Accepted papers will be included in conference proceedings of Lecture Notes in Data Engineering and Communication Technologies series published by Springer. Proceedings will be sent by Springer for indexing in EI and SCOPUS. Authors of accepted papers will be given instructions for submission of camera ready and copyright form. Please submit the paper using the following URL:
cfp.cfp_special_issues: Presented papers at ProvSec2023 will be considered for publication in some Special Issues in International Journals.
